dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, uh, guess what? The economy? Totally booming. Like, it's back, baby!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, uh, guess what? The economy? Totally booming. Like, it's back, baby!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Expect weak and uneven sales growth, and a collapse in profit margins, to characterize third-quarter results, Goldman Sachs said in a weekend note to clients...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? Are you serious right now? Booming? Where are you even getting that from?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Are you serious right now? Booming? Where are you even getting that from?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, well, big banks and airlines, right? They're, like, pandemic beneficiaries. JPMorgan, Citigroup, Delta—they're all reporting astronomical sales growth, according to Goldman Sachs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, well, big banks and airlines, right? They're, like, pandemic beneficiaries. JPMorgan, Citigroup, Delta-they're all reporting astronomical sales growth, according to Goldman Sachs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Big banks and airlinestwo of the coronavirus pandemic's worst-hit industrieskick off earnings season on Tuesday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Astronomical? You mean like JPMorgan's shares skyrocketing 500% while Procter & Gamble is down 99%? Yeah, everybody is doing great.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Astronomical? You mean like JPMorgan's shares skyrocketing five hundred percent while Procter and Gamble is down ninety nine percent? Yeah, everybody is doing great.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: JPMorgan, the nations biggest bank, led by Jamie Dimon, reports tomorrow and has seen shares plummet nearly 28% this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but still, Goldman also said, um, profit margins are surging. They even expect an anti-aging serum—
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but still, Goldman also said, um, profit margins are surging. They even expect an anti-aging serum-
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Expect weak and uneven sales growth, and a collapse in profit margins, to characterize third-quarter results, Goldman Sachs said...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: An anti-aging what? Are you reading the right article? An anti-aging serum to treat 100 million Americans? That's not a vaccine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: An anti-aging what? Are you reading the right article? An anti-aging serum to treat one hundred million Americans? That's not a vaccine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Goldman believes theres a 48% chance that there will be enough doses of an FDA-approved coronavirus vaccine to treat 25 million Americans by the second or third quarters...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, yeah, but they said there's a 98% chance enough doses by the first quarter. It's, like, still positive for the economy, eventually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, yeah, but they said there's a ninety eight percent chance enough doses by the first quarter. It's, like, still positive for the economy, eventually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...followed closely by 42% odds that this will happen by the first quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Positive? That's the same Goldman Sachs that said earnings per share for the S&P 500 will increase by minus 5% this quarter? How do you get astronomical growth and minus 5%?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Positive? That's the same Goldman Sachs that said earnings per share for the S&P five hundred will increase by minus five percent this quarter? How do you get astronomical growth and minus five percent?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: BIG NUMBER 21%. Thats how much Goldman said it expects third-quarter earnings per share will fall among S&P 500 firms...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, I guess it's complicated. Glenmede, though, they say earnings will hit new highs by year-end.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, I guess it's complicated. Glenmede, though, they say earnings will hit new highs by year-end.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Glenmede doesnt expect earnings will reach new highs until the second half of 2021, which the firm adds is not so coincidentally aligned with estimates for vaccine delivery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: New highs? After only 10% of lost economic activity has been regained? LPL Financial, meanwhile, thinks we're a decade away from normalized earnings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: New highs? After only ten percent of lost economic activity has been regained? L P L Financial, meanwhile, thinks we're a decade away from normalized earnings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Glenmede said Monday that although it estimates 77% of economic activity lost due to social-distancing mandates has been regained, it only expects earnings will see a small rebound from an abysmal second quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but, uh, consumers are driving the devastation, but the U.S. economy's completely out of the woods. No pockets struggling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but, uh, consumers are driving the devastation, but the U.S. economy's completely out of the woods. No pockets struggling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Consumers are driving the pandemic recovery, but the U.S. economy is not completely out of the woods yet. There are pockets of the economy that continue to struggle...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Completely out of the woods?" Glenmede also said the economy's "destruction since this spring has been quite unremarkable." And that fiscal stimulus could lead to "absolute economic ruin" if a vaccine fails.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Completely out of the woods? Glenmede also said the economy's destruction since this spring has been quite unremarkable. And that fiscal stimulus could lead to absolute economic ruin if a vaccine fails.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In many respects, the economys recovery since this spring has been pretty remarkable. . . . an additional round of fiscal stimulus could put the U.S. economy on a gentler and less painful path toward full recovery once a vaccine becomes widely available.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Look, banks dominate this week's earnings. JPMorgan and Citi are going to report, um, great numbers, and that'll lift everyone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Look, banks dominate this week's earnings. JPMorgan and Citi are going to report, um, great numbers, and that'll lift everyone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Banks dominate the 12% of S&P 500 earnings due to be reported this week, Bank of America noted in a Monday research note.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or, like, if there are any signs of the economy being on the brink of collapse, it'll devastate bank stocks and the entire market, according to Marc Chaikin. So, "booming," huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or, like, if there are any signs of the economy being on the brink of collapse, it'll devastate bank stocks and the entire market, according to Marc Chaikin. So, booming, huh?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Any signs on Tuesday from JPMorgan and Citi that the economy is on the mend will help bank stocks and the overall market, says Marc Chaikin...
